fields.summary: Add height to summary field and truncate it much later

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot.  The summary card GUI is not making the best use of the limited space on the card.    
- The summary is colored in light grey and way to short.  It is the most important data on the card.  It should be black and given 3 lines (it seems there is room) or at least the 2nd line shouldn't be cut off so early.
- The words "Assignee:" and "Status:" are bold and dark text.  But the actual statuses and assignee names are grey and barely readable.  The actual names and statuses are the most important data, not the field label :)  Please show the actual statuses and assignee names as black (or some standard color you use for all data like royal blue - anything but grey which is hard to read) and I'd remove the bolding from the words "Assignee:" and "Status:"  - the cleanest UI's do very little with coloring and bolding - only adding it in rare cases.  Frankly I'd vote that the labels are light grey and the statuses/names are black (not bold)

fields.description:
Could be nice if we could multi select issues in a page drag them on an issue to rank.

the logic could be
-*IF* drag  --> #1, #3, #7, #9  on # 4-
-*THEN* -->  #7 #9 #4 #1 #3-

The logic will be:
# Regroup the selected issues sorted by rank
# Rank first issue on targeted issue
# Rank n Issue on Issue n-1

ie:
If selection is:
Issue #1
Issue #5
Issue #10

Targeted Issue: Issue #7

Result:
Issue #7
Issue #1
Issue #5
Issue #10

fields.description:
When dragging a single card in the planning board you are given the option to also move its sub-tasks.  However if you select more than one card, you are not given the option and no subtasks are moved.

Expected: you get the same dialog with a union of all associated sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks are not moved when multiple cards are move during planning

fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I would like to restrcit GreenHopper to specific Projects

fields.description:
From the Admin section of JIRA add a GreenHopper configuration.
From this section we want to be able to set default values that will be applicable to all projects.
Of course these values can be overwritten by the project configuration.

The values that can be settable from this section are:
- Need Scheduling Permission  	
- Use JIRA look and feel
- Use JIRA IFrame
- Issue Link type
- Card colours
- Task board columns and JIRA workflow statuses.

The other values are Project - Issue Type specific so can't be generalized.
fields.summary: As a JIRA admin I would like to be able to create a default configuration applicable to all projects
